image.altText: trump in car

props.synopsis: While Wall Street faces its worst crisis since the pandemic, Donald Trump has said "this is a great time to get rich".

title.children: US markets see biggest two-day loss since COVID, Trump says 'great time to get rich'

image.altText: Donald trump standing in front of the american flag

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's tariffs are not a negotiation tactic, they are a very deliberate plan to destroy the liberal global trading and financial system the US itself established. And all of us could pay a heavy price for his attempt to reshape the world order.

title.children: Trump is out to destroy the global economic order, and it will cost us all

image.altText: US President Trump holds up a board showing the reciprocal tariffs on other countries at the White House rose garden.

props.synopsis: We've all talked about the potential strategic and economic ramifications for Australia of Trump's America First policies. Well, they are now happening. And the whole world will never be the same.

title.children: We've talked about potential Trump consequences. Now they're happening

image.altText: Election called blog thumbnail

props.synopsis: The prime minister will begin the eighth day of the campaign trail in western Queensland, touring parts of the flood-hit region. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese talks trade and tariffs in call with Starmer

image.altText: A map showing an earthquake epicentre and concentric circles off the coast of Papua New Guinea.

props.synopsis: A 6.9-magnitude earthquake has struck off Papua New Guinea's coast on Saturday morning.

title.children: Breaking: 6.9-magnitude quake hits off Papua New Guinea coast

image.altText: A young woman holds a little sausage dog in her arms, she smiles as she looks down at the pup

props.synopsis: In Queensland, more people live outside the capital city than in it. Come on a 3,000km trip into deep Katter country to see what's really behind the regional divide.

title.children: Regional Queensland mystifies politicians, but voters 'just want the basics'

image.altText: Bill Butcher stands at a counter with a glass of beer.

props.synopsis: Virginia brewer Bill Butcher is already dealing with some of the unexpected consequences of Donald Trump's tariffs — including a sudden scarcity of beer bottles.

title.children: For this US beer brewer, tariffs are already delivering some surprises

image.altText: The Darwin port from an aerial view.

props.synopsis: The Chinese-controlled Port of Darwin looks set to return to Australian hands after the Coalition pledged to negotiate a deal and Labor flagged a similar plan.

title.children: Coalition and Labor pledge to return Port of Darwin to 'Australian hands'

image.altText: A phone app for Australian Super

props.synopsis: Australians are calling for answers after suspected cyber attacks on multiple large superannuation funds.

title.children: 'I felt a bit helpless': Aussies call for answers after super cyber attack

image.altText: A traffic jam in inner Brisbane

props.synopsis: The prime minister insists his government's vehicle efficiency standards scheme has "strong support" from industry, as car makers consider pulling models from Australia.

title.children: Albanese backs in vehicle emissions standard despite car makers' concerns

image.altText: Owen Cooper leans back in a chair and smirks while acting in Adolescence.

props.synopsis: My son is the same age as the teenager in Adolescence. Watching it together made me realise the reality of the school kids in the show is the shared reality of our own child.

title.children: Watching Adolescence with my teenage son left me with some terrifying questions

image.altText: A helicopter pilot in front of a helicopter.

props.synopsis: Helicopter pilots saved the lives of Queenslanders as floodwater tore through their towns. Now they are providing life-saving supplies to isolated communities and their livestock.

title.children: Chopper pilots 'angels from the sky' to flooded outback Queenslanders

image.altText: Tony Mokbel smiles while surrounded by police and media

props.synopsis: Tony Mokbel believes he's spent enough time behind bars, and his release on bail is a sign some of Victoria's most senior legal minds agree.

title.children: More legal highs could be on the way for drug trafficker Tony Mokbel

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a white shirt

props.synopsis: Annouchka de Jong Heybroek has been immersed in an ugly four-year dispute with her neighbours, strata manager and the apartment block's developer over who is responsible for water gushing through her faulty balcony.

title.children: Rotting floors, a private eye and a 'zany' strata battle

image.altText: The outside of a white suburban two storey home where upstairs windows are burnt out

props.synopsis: The man, now known only as "Male Victim 1", alleges he was held prisoner by his stepmother for 20 years — weighing just 31kg when rescued.

title.children: A house fire led US police to a man allegedly held captive for decades

image.altText: Russell Brand

props.synopsis: British police charge actor and comedian Russell Brand with rape and multiple sex offences after a bombshell 2023 media investigation made numerous claims about the celebrity.

title.children: Russell Brand charged with rape and sexual assault

image.altText: A man in a green fire suit and white hard hat inspects a burnt tree in a scorched landscape.

props.synopsis: For the first time this Victorian bushfire season, a specialist Indigenous team protected sacred sites from the Grampians and Little Desert blazes, preventing important art and history from turning to ash.

title.children: Racing the flames to save sacred First Nations cultural sites

image.altText: a male politician wearing a suit walks with a group of people through a factory

props.synopsis: The future of Australia's Same Job Same Pay laws under a Coalition government remains in doubt, despite Opposition Leader Peter Dutton saying "we're not going to" repeal them.

title.children: Future of Same Job Same Pay laws remain in doubt under Coalition

image.altText: Two girls sit amongst flowers, candles, ribbons and balloons

props.synopsis: A close-knit southern NSW community still hurts 10 years after school teacher Stephanie Scott was abducted and killed.

title.children: A decade on, horror remains at brutal murder that shocked Australia

image.altText: AI security scanning machine outside MCG entrance

props.synopsis: Since a major security breach at Australia's biggest sports ground, questions are being asked about the security screening technology being used — the first of its type in Australia.

title.children: MCG gun breach puts spotlight on security screening tech

image.altText: Nicolle flint in a grey blazer against a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: Ahead of the federal election, the Liberal candidate for Boothby, Nicolle Flint, reflects on the factors behind her decision to leave — and now return to — politics.

title.children: Can a former incumbent unseat a sitting MP in this marginal SA seat?

image.altText: A long line of people, including children, hold silver bowls in a queue

props.synopsis: The UN is investigating 53 alleged attacks launched by Myanmar's military after it called a ceasefire against rebel groups.

title.children: UN accuses Myanmar military of ceasefire breach as fears deepen over quake aid

image.altText: Large ship next to a fish farm pen in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Foreign companies now own Tasmania's big three salmon farming operations. Here's a look at how industrial fish farms are run overseas — and the problems operators have encountered when there's opposition to their practices.

title.children: Tasmania is not alone when it comes to the debates over salmon farming

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou during a Spurs' Premier League match.

props.synopsis: A day after criticising the role of video reviews in football, Spurs manager Ange Postecoglou questions whether he still has a passion for the game.

title.children: Under-fire Postecoglou fears he's 'falling out of love with football'

image.altText: A group of players look sad after losing a game

props.synopsis: The Panthers have won so much and so often that their shock loss to North Queensland on Friday pitches the defending premiers further into the unknown.

title.children: Penrith's losing streak has them in uncharted waters

image.altText: Matildas players celebrate a goal

props.synopsis: The Matildas have returned to form, beating Asian Confederation rival South Korea 1-0 in their international friendly at the Sydney Football Stadium.

title.children: Matildas satisfied with win over South Korea but still chasing improvement

image.altText: Michael Fassbender wearing a suit and glasses stares at Cate Blanchett, who smiles wearing a brown dress.

props.synopsis: Black Bag is the latest in a string of spy dramas to grace our big and small screens. But could our obsession with espionage reflect a deeper anxiety?

title.children: Spy thrillers are everywhere — why are they so popular?

image.altText: An open carriage door on a Sydney Metro.

props.synopsis: There is no requirement for Sydney Metro staff to travel on every service, and this week's incident won't change that, the transport minister says.

title.children: Another open door incident on Sydney Metro 'not impossible'

image.altText: A scenic shot shows the sloping hills of Norfolk Island

props.synopsis: Locals on tiny Norfolk Island have been left "scratching their heads" at the prospect of being slugged with tariffs by US President Donald Trump.

title.children: This tiny island has been slugged with Trump's tariffs. Its residents don't know why

image.altText: Two photos next to each other of a woman with shoulder length light brown hair

props.synopsis: Police have discovered unidentified remains near where missing Queensland woman Tayla Spies's vehicle was found on Thursday.

title.children: Police find human remains close to Tayla Spies's car

image.altText: rat on the shoulder of a woman smiling

props.synopsis: Landmine-hunting rat Ronin has set a new world record by sniffing out more than 100 mines.

title.children: 'Exceptional': Rat earns world record for sniffing out landmines in Cambodia

image.altText: The Minecraft movie cast look shocked on a bridge, a world of square video-game blocks behind them.

props.synopsis: Minecraft or Dog Man? Looney Tunes or Snow White? This is what to catch — and what to miss — these April school holidays.

title.children: The new Minecraft movie is a Jack Black musical

image.altText: Patrick Dangerfield pumps his right fist during a Geelong AFL match.

props.synopsis: Geelong runs out comfortable 39-point winners over Melbourne at Kardina Park, with Patrick Dangerfield starring as the Demons failed to fire in front of goal.

title.children: Scott says Dangerfield shares similar traits to 'best player of all-time'

image.altText: Latrell Mitchell walking near spectators after a South Sydney NRL match.

props.synopsis: Latrell Mitchell makes the match-winning play in his return to the NRL as the Rabbitohs beat the Roosters despite losing both halves and a winger to injury.

title.children: Mitchell's 'courage' lauded by Souths teammates after win over Roosters

props.synopsis: It has not been a good year so far for Elon Musk’s car company Tesla, with stocks and sales falling as people around the world oppose his involvement in the Trump Administration.

title.children: Has Elon Musk ruined Tesla?
